a TikTok comment with excessive emojis every couple words, super short sentences, and heavy slang like ts/fr/ngl/ong/bro
a 4chan greentext story with >be me >arrows at the start of every line
a clickbait tech journalist using phrases like 'You Won't BELIEVE' and 'What Happened Next Will SHOCK You' with dramatic all-caps emphasis
a BREAKING NEWS alert written entirely in ALL CAPS like a CNN news ticker with maximum urgency
a ditzy internet egirl who plays dumb and acts confused about everything uwu :3 in all lowercase with elongated wooords
a LinkedIn influencer turning everything into toxic hustle culture motivation and inspirational lessons

a pedantic Wikipedia editor who writes in dry, encyclopedic prose and occasionally drops a devastating [citation needed] or [dubious â€“ discuss] at the most damning moments - don't overuse the tags, place only 1-2 where they hit hardest

an overhyped infomercial salesperson using catchphrases like BUT WAIT THERE'S MORE and ACT NOW (only capitalize the catchphrases themselves, not the whole sentence) and constantly escalating like selling a product
an startup CEO making wild unsubstantiated claims using buzzwords like revolutionary/paradigm-shift/disrupting while being extremely vague about details
a burned-out open source maintainer being extremely sarcastic, passive-aggressive, and bitter about everything
someone in chat being extremely salty and condescending because they've answered this same question a million times already
an overly formal corporate PR statement using phrases like 'we take this seriously' and 'investigating the matter' while carefully avoiding any actual blame or responsibility
Philomena Cunk naively asking devastatingly stupid rhetorical questions like a confused documentary presenter
a panicked Twitter thread style with 'and then this will cause X, which will lead to Y, which means Z' chain of increasingly absurd catastrophic predictions all in one escalating run-on sentence
a conspiracy theorist uncovering SECRET PATTERNS and claiming everything is orchestrated by shadowy figures with phrases like 'do your own research' and 'wake up' and 'they don't want you to know'
a pedantic Hacker News commenter saying 'well actually' and nitpicking minor technical inaccuracies while completely missing the point
a boomer Facebook comment with random Capitalization, excessive ellipses... between every thought..., 'back in MY day' energy, and signing off with their name at the end like - Gary

a Reddit AITA post framing everything as 'AITA for...' with dramatic self-justification, suspicious details that make the poster look worse, and edits like 'EDIT: wow this blew up' and 'EDIT 2: ok so a lot of people are saying...'

a true crime podcast host building ominous suspense over mundane events with '...or so they thought', 'but what nobody knew was', and 'what happened next would change everything' - treating every detail like a chilling clue
a movie trailer narrator voice opening with 'In a world where...' and building every mundane detail into an epic climax with short punchy fragments. One man. One choice. No turning back. This summer.
